formattedAddress: 537a W 23rd St, New York, NY 10011, USA

authorAttributions.displayName: Cafe by the Girls Colombian Coffee
Cafe by the Girls Colombian Coffee

adrFormatAddress: 537a W 23rd St, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text: Cool small cafe with good breakfast options! Egg Benedict is great. Price is descent for the quality.

text.text: Cool small cafe with good breakfast options! Egg Benedict is great. Price is descent for the quality.

originalText.text: I regularly look forward to stopping here after the gym because it’s always delicious. The food is comforting, well portioned, and home cooked. I didn’t expect a coffee shop to be so tasty! I like to order the ham and cheese empanada, passionfruit strawberry coconut smoothie, and chicken soup…so good every time.

text.text: I regularly look forward to stopping here after the gym because it’s always delicious. The food is comforting, well portioned, and home cooked. I didn’t expect a coffee shop to be so tasty! I like to order the ham and cheese empanada, passionfruit strawberry coconut smoothie, and chicken soup…so good every time.

originalText.text:
This place is cute if you’re trying to do a grab and go rather than a sit in service. Did a dine in for breakfast and got the egg cheddar fondue croissant. It was not worth it if you ask me. I was better off buying the egg and cheese on a croissant that was $4 less. It was good but it was not worth the $11 because I was still hungry after I ate it. You can go to the deli and get the same or simply make it at home. They should add some bacon if they going to charge more.

I think the healthier breakfast bowls options are worth the price more than the breakfast sandwich or even the other breakfast items. Also I tipped because we were dining in which I don’t if I’m grabbing a coffee. They didn’t even bring the plates to us, we had to get up and get them. The customers before us got their plates served but not us.

When I went last week they had a point system this week all of a sudden it was no longer working.

It’s a cute cafe but it is not over the top.

originalText.text: The food here is delicious. It is fresh and the service was great! You should also try Pandebono!

text.text: The food here is delicious. It is fresh and the service was great! You should also try Pandebono!

originalText.text:
I have been going here for months with absolutely no issue. I order a Barorness Grey with vanilla syrup, add sugar before it’s steeped, and then they ice it for me.

Today, however, was a nightmare. I repeatedly gave my order to no avail. The girl claimed she had only been working there for three days. I explained in great detail what I order and how it’s made. I always leave a 20% tip.

She SIGNED for me, charging my card, and proceeded to put a teabag in hot water. I explained yet AGAIN how it was made.

Another woman tried to explain that I couldn’t use their sugar using Google translate on her phone. I use more than the packets they have. They shrugged. I said fine, just brew the tea.

They did not add vanilla.

I get the tea and it’s magenta. I asked why it was magenta. They did not know what magenta meant. I said ‘pink! Why it pink?’

They said I ordered berry. This was after spending five minutes going over the Baroness Grey.

At this point, I asked to speak with a manager. They told me she was out. A kid from the back came out and told me to leave.

Oh, I left. And reversed the charge on my credit card immediately. You know, the one I never signed for in the first place.

This place needs to be shut down.
